            </gmd:citation>
            <gmd:abstract>
                <gco:CharacterString>GW Solutions’ team is supporting Keepers of the Athabasca to learn more about the connection between surface water and groundwater and the water quality around tailing ponds in Northern Alberta. The team has been gathering, cleaning, standardizing and integrating groundwater and surface water quality and quantity data from different sources of information. We have interpreted the data and developed a visualization tool and digital platform detailing groundwater and surface water quality and their potential interaction. The outcome of this project could improve the knowledge of communities, industry, and the public to understand, manage, and protect water.
The two main sources of surface water quality that GW Solutions used for its study are Alberta Environment and Parks dataset and Regional Aquatics Monitoring Program (RAMP) database.   

The funders of the project are Keepers of the Athabasca and The Alberta Ecotrust Foundation with in- kind contribution of GW Solutions team</gco:CharacterString>
            </gmd:abstract>

keywords_translation_method.fr: Keyword text translated using the Amazon translate service / texte traduit à l'aide du service Amazon translate

name: 10-25976-388f-h804
notes:
GW Solutions’ team is supporting Keepers of the Athabasca to learn more about the connection between surface water and groundwater and the water quality around tailing ponds in Northern Alberta. The team has been gathering, cleaning, standardizing and integrating groundwater and surface water quality and quantity data from different sources of information. We have interpreted the data and developed a visualization tool and digital platform detailing groundwater and surface water quality and their potential interaction. The outcome of this project could improve the knowledge of communities, industry, and the public to understand, manage, and protect water.
The two main sources of surface water quality that GW Solutions used for its study are Alberta Environment and Parks dataset and Regional Aquatics Monitoring Program (RAMP) database.   

The funders of the project are Keepers of the Athabasca and The Alberta Ecotrust Foundation with in- kind contribution of GW Solutions team

notes_translated.en:
GW Solutions’ team is supporting Keepers of the Athabasca to learn more about the connection between surface water and groundwater and the water quality around tailing ponds in Northern Alberta. The team has been gathering, cleaning, standardizing and integrating groundwater and surface water quality and quantity data from different sources of information. We have interpreted the data and developed a visualization tool and digital platform detailing groundwater and surface water quality and their potential interaction. The outcome of this project could improve the knowledge of communities, industry, and the public to understand, manage, and protect water.
The two main sources of surface water quality that GW Solutions used for its study are Alberta Environment and Parks dataset and Regional Aquatics Monitoring Program (RAMP) database.   

The funders of the project are Keepers of the Athabasca and The Alberta Ecotrust Foundation with in- kind contribution of GW Solutions team
notes_translated.fr:
L'équipe de GW Solutions aide Keepers of the Athabasca à en apprendre davantage sur le lien entre les eaux de surface et les eaux souterraines et sur la qualité de l'eau autour des bassins de décantation du nord de l'Alberta. L'équipe a collecté, nettoyé, normalisé et intégré des données sur la qualité et la quantité des eaux souterraines et de surface provenant de différentes sources d'information. Nous avons interprété les données et développé un outil de visualisation et une plateforme numérique détaillant la qualité des eaux souterraines et de surface ainsi que leur interaction potentielle. Les résultats de ce projet pourraient améliorer les connaissances des communautés, de l'industrie et du public en matière de compréhension, de gestion et de protection de l'eau.
Les deux principales sources de qualité des eaux de surface utilisées par GW Solutions pour son étude sont l'ensemble de données de l'Alberta Environment and Parks et la base de données du Regional Aquatics Monitoring Program (RAMP). 

Les bailleurs de fonds du projet sont Keepers of the Athabasca et The Alberta Ecotrust Foundation, avec la contribution en nature de l'équipe de GW Solutions.
